data.name: The Goobles Challenge - Part 1
data.description:
*This is part 1 of a multi-part series of katas. Although not strictly necessary it is advised to complete the katas in order as they are designed to become increasingly difficult.*

* **[Part 1](https://www.codewars.com/kata/the-goobles-challenge-part-1)**
* [Part 2](https://www.codewars.com/kata/the-goobles-challenge-part-2)

# Story #
On the planet *Gooble* a large group of lively little creatures, the *Goobles*, spend all their days building beautiful sand sculptures. As their town elder you are tasked with helping the *Goobles* build their sculptures as efficiently as possible. Each day, every *Gooble* wakes up, optionally trains to become extra strong, walk to the sand mines to get the special sculpting sand, return to town and then build their sculpture.

# Problem #
The previous *Gooble* town elders have established the following laws for all *Goobles* :
* Every *Gooble* must attempt to make a sand sculpture each day.
* Each *Gooble* gets assigned a **square** spot with sides of **D** meters on the town square to build their sculpture (so the area of the spot is **D** x **D** or **DÂ²** square meters).
* Each sand sculpture must use exactly **100** kilograms of sand for every **square meter** of building space the *Gooble* was assigned. Building a sculpture always takes exactly **one hour**.
* *Goobles* are allowed to bring more sand into town than they strictly need to finish their sculpture.
* Each *Gooble* must carry their own sand from the sand mine back to town. The run to the mine, loading the sand and carry the sand back takes exactly **one hour** in total.
* *Goobles* must finish their sculpture before the day ends. On the planet *Gooble* each day has an arbitrary amount of hours that only you, the town elder, knows exactly. Each *Gooble* is told at the start of the day how many hours they have to work with.

Each *Gooble* wakes up with a random amount of strength, expressed in the amount of kilograms **S** of sand they can carry per trip. A *Gooble* can double their strength **S** for each **full hour** they spend training in town. If a *Gooble* does not train for exactly the full hour their strength is not increased.

Your challenge is to provide each *Gooble* with the **shortest** possible schedule of instructions that allows them to build a sculpture without breaking any of the *Gooble* laws.

The schedule is a string of capital letters, each letter instructing the *Gooble* how to spend their time that hour. The allowed instructions are :

```
T : Spend the hour training, doubling Gooble strength.
C : Carry sand back and forth to town. A Gooble will always bring exactly the amount of sand they can carry.
B : Build the sculpture. This must be the last instruction on the schedule.
```

For example, for a *Gooble* that starts with **S=100** and a schedule that reads ```TTCCB``` would instruct the *Gooble* to train for 2 hours and double its strength 2 times to 400 (after the first hour **S=200** and the second hour **S=400**). Then the *Gooble* would make two trips to the sand mine each time picking up 400 kilograms of sand for 800 kilograms in total. Thus, with this instruction set a *Gooble* can build a sculpture with at most 800 kilograms of sand and they can do it in 5 hours (remember, each instruction in the schedule represents exactly one hour).

If there is no possible schedule where the *Gooble* can construct the sculpture before the day ends your schedule should just read ```TBCB``` (Too Big, Can't Build). Note that due to there being two ```B``` instructions in this schedule this schedule is not valid, despite all letters corresponding to individual instructions.

# Input #
You are tasked to implement the function ```instruct``` that has the following inputs :
```
S : The strength S with which the Gooble wakes up this day.
D : The length of each side D of the square spot on the town square assigned to the Gooble.
hoursInTheDay : The amount of hours that make up this day on the planet Gooble
```

You can assume the values for ```S```, ```D``` and ```hoursInTheDay``` will be in the range of 0 to 1000. The following situations must result in a ```TBCB``` schedule :
* If there are not enough hours in the day to construct the sculpture according to *Gooble* law
* If there are zero (0) hours in the day
* If a *Gooble* wakes up with 0 strength
* If a *Gooble* gets assigned a spot with D = 0

# Output #
As output your ```instruct``` function must return a string with the schedule for the *Gooble*. All instructions must be uppercase letters as described in the problem section. The output must either be a valid schedule or ```TBCB``` if no such schedule exists.
